content: All these “but maybe being completely out of debt isn’t the answer” articles lately are messing with my head! I have $25k in a savings account and $40k in my 401k. Also, another $1k or so invested in the stock market. I owe $40k in student loans and $130k on my mortgage (on a house worth 4ook). No credit card debt. I’ve been aggressively paying down my mortgage/student loans with the goal of being debt-free. Should I be funneling that money into investments instead?
